sections.instructions: Questions 21–26: Choose TWO letters A–E. Questions 27–30: Choose A, B or C.
sections.title: Joanna’s Psychology Study

questions.question: Which TWO characteristics were shared by the subjects of Joanna’s psychology study?
options: A they had all won prizes for their music
B they had all made music recordings
C they were all under 27 years old
D they had all toured internationally
E they all played a string instrument

questions.question: Which TWO points does Joanna make about her use of telephone interviews?
options: A it meant rich data could be collected
B it allowed the involvement of top performers
C it led to a stressful atmosphere at times
D it meant interview times had to be limited
E it caused some technical problems

questions.question: Which TWO topics did Joanna originally intend to investigate in her research?
options: B audience reactions to the dress of performers
C changes in performer attitudes to concert dress
D how choice of music relates to performer roles
E links between musical instrument and dress choice

questions.question: Joanna concentrated on women performers because
options: A women are more influenced by fashion
B women’s dress has led to more controversy
C women’s code of dress is less strict than men’s

questions.question: Mike Frost’s article suggests that in popular music, women’s dress is affected by
options: A their wish to be taken seriously
B their tendency to copy each other
C their reaction to the masculine nature of the music

questions.question: What did Joanna’s subjects say about the incidence at a performance?
options: A The musicians’ choice of clothing is linked to respect for the audience
B The clothing should not distract the audience from the music
C The audience should make an effort to dress appropriately

questions.question: According to the speakers, musicians could learn from sports scientists about
options: A the importance of clothing for physical freedom
B the part played by clothing in improving performance
C the way clothing may protect against physical injury

sections.instructions: Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.
sections.title: The use of soil to reduce carbon dioxide (CO₂) in the atmosphere

questions.question: Carbon in soil may remain there for ____
Land in Africa that was very ____
Plants turn CO₂ from the air into carbon-based substances such as ____
Some CO₂ moves from the ____ of plants to microbes in the soil
Carbon was lost from the soil when ____ was invented
Increasing the ____ of plants that are grown
Taking place on a big ____ farm
Using compost made from waste from agriculture and ____
Using ____ that are always green
Giving farmers ____ for carbon storage
